info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 3:12AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a Red Flag Warning for the areas listed below, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM EDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...All of Southern New England except The Cape and Islands * TIMING...Friday from noon through 8 pm. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 40s. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Dry weather and gusty winds will result in potentially critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, .or will shortly. Any fires that start may spread rapidly and become difficult to extinguish.
